verbose_text: Moreover, PET studies comparing a tetrameric structure containing four c (RGDfE) peptides with a tetrameric compound containing only one c (RGDfE) and three c (RaDFE) peptides, which do not bind to the alphavbeta3 integrin, showed a threefold lower activity accumulation in the tumour for the pseudo monomeric tetramer than for the " real " tetramer, indicating that the higher uptake in the tumour really is due to multimerisation and not based on other structural effects XREF_BIBR.
evidence: PET studies comparing a tetrameric structure containing four c(RGDfE) peptides with a tetrameric compound containing only one c(RGDfE) and three c(RaDFE) peptides, which do not bind to the alphavbeta3 integrin
